INT. OPERA HOUSE, STAGE DOOR, DAY

INT. OPERA GARNIER, STAGE, NEXT DAY

INT. ART DEALER'S OFFICE, HALF AN HOUR LATER

INT. RADIUM INSTITUTE, RECOVERY ROOM, NEXT DAY
INT/EXT. JUTLAND, DAWN, TWO WEEKS LATER
EXT. WIDOW HOUSE, EARLY MORNING, TWO WEEKS LATER
INT. WIDOW HOUSE, COPENHAGEN. STUDIO, 1 MONTH LATER, DAY
EXT. CLIFFS OVERLOOKING KATTEGAT SEA, JUTLAND, MORNING
INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STAIRS LEADING UP, DAY
INT. WIDOW HOUSE, KITCHEN, 20 MINUTES LATER
INT. THE WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, MORNING
INT. ROYAL ACADEMY OF ARTS, GREAT HALL, NIGHT

INT. ART DEALER'S OFFICE, COPENHAGEN, DAY
INT. 22 RUE DE NUIT, 1ST FLOOR LANDING, DAY

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: A rectangle of ferociously stormy sea viewed from battere cliffs. Silver waves are whipped by a wind that flies at stinging, relentless. Somewhere, unseen in the barren landscape, something is at its mercy - we hear the RUSTLE PUNCH of the weather going at it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same scene reflected across the surface of a woman’s brown eye, intense with emotion, curiosity. Gradually, th WEATHER SOUNDS are overtaken by VOICES coming up. At firs the SOCIAL CHATTER is PERIPHERAL, then the VOICES grow mo STRIDENT, OPPRESSIVE. The eye blinks.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GALLERY, COPENHAGEN, DENMARK, EVENING
dialogues.text: A painting of the same sea, captured with remarkable accu of feeling. A HUBBUB OF GABBLING VOICES. Too many people a low-ceilinged room. One voice dominates now -

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't you wish you could paint like that? We pull out to see GERDA WEGENER’S brown eyes shift from scrutiny of the painting to polite social focus as she ta in an excited OLDER WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: I said, don't you wish you could paint like your husband? Really - you must be so proud... The woman smiles and heads into the crowd, leaving Gerda consider... Gerda’s gaze travels across the well-dressed gathering. Far off in a corner, there’s an inner circle where her handsome husband EINAR WEGENER is being showere with praise. A portly goateed man dominates the scene - RASMUSSEN, Einar’s dealer.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: They're all Veijle, where he grew up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda begins walking toward them through the throng... RASMUSSEN (cont'd) And I don't say my client is the best landscape artist in Denmark... but, he is in the top one! Einar cringes as the crowd laughs, delighted. An exotic- looking woman with mischief playing on her full lips approaches Gerda. This is ULLA FONSMARCK. They're friends

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: (a stage whisper) It's going very well.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Oh yes. He’1l be impossible. The women LAUGH. As Gerda looks up, Einar looks across, smiles, trapped in his corner. Gerda nods back, reassurin conspiratorial. Then Einar’s pulled back into the select circle and Rasmussen emits a ridiculous barking LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. COPENHAGEN STREET, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda and Einar, arm in arm, LAUGHING. Gerda wears a distinctively embroidered fine wool wrap. Their FOOTSTEPS ring down the empty street. A patina of crystallised brin coats doorways, windows, scintillating in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: And Rasmussen...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. Be kind. At least he agreed to see your work.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Only because he was drunk!

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You were loving it!

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I was not. She mimics Rasmussen, his ludicrous excitement:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: “I don’t say my client is the best landscape artist in Denmark...” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: “He is in the top one!” They LAUGH hard. Someone calls from an upstairs window:

dialogues.speaker: MAN AT WINDOW
dialogues.text: Hey - people are sleeping! The window SLAMS. Gerda and Einar struggle to quieten dow head for the dancing harbour lights - partners in crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishermen selling straight off the boats to early-rising customers. Prices are loudly negotiated as the silver cat still writhes and flaps. A city coming to life.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, MORNING
dialogues.text: Gerda carries in a breakfast tray. Einar sleeps. She obse his face: long eyelashes, cheeks hollow in repose, delica lips. A little dog, HVAPPE, trots beside her. She puts do the tray and throws back the bedcover. Einar blinks in th light, surprised. He stretches, takes in the silhouetted outline of his wife: tall, purposeful Gerda.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Do you know what time it is? He smiles, sweetly suggestive of pleasure to come...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Time you came back to bed?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No - I’m ready to start work.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Draw down the blinds. She holds back, teases a little.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I told you, I...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes him in, smiling up at her. Shakes her head. GERDA (cont'd) Your face... You think I can’t resist you...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Do you want to resist me? She approaches the edge of the bed, smiling herself now.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No. But I’d like you to ask nicely so I don’t feel such a pushover... Einar reaches towards her.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda Wegener - my life, my wife... He pulls her into bed... A skittish piano comes up as the laugh, begin to make love. Continues over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einar crosses the road, heads for the Opera House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einar greets the doorman, THORBJORN.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Thorbjorn.

dialogues.speaker: STAGE DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Mr Wegener.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OPERA HOUSE, COSTUME SHOP, ONE MONTH LATER, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar walks between racks of clothes that hang in two tie so the ruffled and feathered hems of jewel-coloured gowns brush his cheeks. An explicit sensual pleasure, which Ein is conscious of but feels no need to investigate. He paus The ARIA ceases, he hears women CHATTING, sometimes DROPP THEIR VOICES, emitting DIRTY LAUGHS, which make him smile wonder. A stolen intimacy. Einar spies on Ulla, below -

dialogues.speaker: ULLA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tighter! Ulla is being pulled into a corset by a DRESSER. Einar le forward for a better view... She spots him - is delighted breaks free for a moment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULLA (cont'd) Einar Wegener! The DRESSER hands Ulla a robe to cover up, but: ULLA (cont'd) Oh don’t worry about him - he’s only ever had eyes for one woman.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: My guilty secret’s out. He smiles at her, indulgent. She calls up to him -

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: So - when are you two going to breed me a godchild?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You’re an atheist.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: I’1l reconsider.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: We're trying.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Try harder. I’ve been waiting an eternity. Have you tried drinking raw eggs?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Do it. For my sake. Einar shakes his head. She’s impossible and he adores her ULLA (cont'd) Anyway what are you doing in today? I thought you finished last week?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I wanted to check on the scrim for the storm scene. And give Gerda some space.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Ah - she’s got a shy one. Einar nods, smiles. Ulla prepares to resume her fitting. ULLA (cont'd) You know I’m next?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: So I heard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: I won’t be shy.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I should imagine not.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Good God, she’ll need all her colours for me! They LAUGH and Ulla signals to the dresser to pull at the corset once more, smiles in delighted anticipation of the discomfort to come.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STUDIO, DAY
dialogues.text: MR FONNESBECH in a chair on a slightly raised dais. He is formally dressed, somewhat stiff. The room is oppressivel still. Gerda looks up from her canvas, goes to adjust Fonnesbech’s arm. He is clearly affected by being touched embarrassed. She returns to the canvas. After an uncomfortable couple of moments:

dialogues.speaker: FONNESBECH
dialogues.text: I wanted to say... I appreciate our being alone today. I hope your husband doesn’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Not at all. I could see his being here made you uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: FONNESBECH
dialogues.text: It wasn’t personal. Gerda smiles. Shakes her head - he shouldn’t worry:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It’s not uncommon.

dialogues.speaker: FONNESBECH
dialogues.text: Ah. Fonnesbech’s relieved. Though he’s left with questions.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It’s hard for a man to be looked at by a woman. Women are used to it, of course, but for a man... Mr Fonnesbech begins to look wildly vulnerable. GERDA (cont'd) To... submit to a woman’s gaze. It’s unsettling... Fonnesbech nods, relieved - that’s exactly it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GERDA (cont'd) Although I believe there’s some pleasure to be had from it, once you... She smiles mischievously. GERDA (cont'd) «yield. Fonnesbech swallows, cheeks pinking. Suddenly: GERDA (cont'd) sit! Fonnesbech flinches. The dog settles. Fonnesbech exhales. GERDA (cont'd) Good girl. Gerda returns to work, eyes glinting at what she’s reveal in her sitter: finally getting somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WIDOW HOUSE, MONTHS LATER
dialogues.text: A CHINESE LAUNDRESS with a large wheeled cart makes her w along the street, RINGING a pair of little BELLS as she g

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, MORNING
dialogues.text: Einar quickly but carefully folds Gerda’s chemise and put in a bag of laundry, hurries to open the door...

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. WIDOW HOUSE, EARLY MORNING, A MONTH LATER
dialogues.text: Einar hands the bag to the laundress as she passes.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, MORNING
dialogues.text: Gerda at the mirror, putting on her lipstick. Einar comes in, reacts, seeing her dressed up. She’s self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Well? Einar can’t help smiling at her implied self-criticism.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Perfect. Almost. He approaches, uses his thumb to gently blend away a smud of lipstick from her bottom lip. He nods. Perfect now. EINAR (cont'd) Good luck... 26/11/15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda carries her heavy portfolio, optimistic, brisk.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ART DEALER'S OFFICE, DAY
dialogues.text: Rasmussen's face - a look of slight distaste. A sea of Gerda’s work, on the desk, the floor - competent but uninspiring naturalistic depictions of society figures.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: All portraits... Gerda hesitates a beat, the fact being so self-evident.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Is that bad?

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: Not per se, but... this kind of work is not really my... He winces a little. He has to end this: RASMUSSEN (cont'd) Gerda... I don’t think it would benefit either of us to show these. A vein begins to throb in Gerda’s neck. RASMUSSEN (cont'd) It’s not a judgement on your abilities - I agree with Einar: you could be a first class painter if you found the right subject matter. It’s the first time Gerda’s heard this. Her eyes shine, stung, betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STUDIO, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar works, hears the door. Gerda brings in the portfoli sets it down, starts taking off her coat. Einar’s tentati

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: How was it?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Fine. He waits for more, but nothing comes.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I finally mixed the right colour for the snow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda glances at the canvas, hostile.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Another view of Vejle. I don’t know how you can paint the same thing over and over. Einar misses a beat.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I suppose I just haven’t finished with it yet. Gerda heads towards the door. EINAR (cont'd) Gerda..?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Could you please not speak to Rasmussen about me again... My work is my business. Stay out of it. But she disappears into the bedroom, the door slamming emphatically behind her. Einar’s left bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda’s already regretting the exchange with Einar. She unfastens her dress, pulls it off. There’s a bloodstain i her underwear. Damn! She breathes.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDIO, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar working as Gerda reappears. She’s composed now, refocused, approaches her easel, organises her paints. Ei steals a look at her, but says nothing. Works on. Eventually:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I have my period.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Are you? She turns to find him approaching.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Of course I am... You know I am. A moment of quiet intimacy between them. Gerda shies away returns to present concerns... her work... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Could you help me with something? Einar’s relieved to be able to help.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Ulla has an extra rehearsal. She cancelled again. Would you try on her stockings and shoes? Einar’s discomfort erupts in a laugh. Is she serious? GERDA (cont'd) I'm just so behind. I don’t know how I’11 be finished in time for her opening... But he cuts her off:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I'll do it. It’s fine. Gerda sets a shoebox and the stocking on the sitter’s cha goes into the kitchen. Einar moves the box and stockings, sits in the chair on the dais. The dog leaps up - EINAR (cont'd) No... no, not now Hvappe... He pushes Hvappe down, tests the mesh of the stockings be fingers. He rolls up his trousers. EINAR (cont'd) He almost snagged this... Gerda marvels at his delicacy. Scolds the dog:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Hvappe... Gerda mixes paints. Einar battles with the stockings. GERDA (cont'd) That’s backwards... He fiddles with the second stocking now, a light sweat de his forehead by the time he’s rolled both to the knee. He opens a shoebox: - the yellow pair from the shop window.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I saw these in the window of Fonnesbech’s...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Smart aren’t they? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I don’t think they'll fit...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Well just do what you can. He takes them out... Something catches in Einar’s throat he pushes his toes into the shoe. Gerda’s eyes are narrow she starts work. Einar looks down at his feet, partly contained in the yellow suede, the disjuncture between th body above and below the knee... he breathes... can’t kee his hands steady. Then: GERDA (cont'd) No. I need the dress. They both look over to where Ulla’s dress hangs. It is wh weighted with beads at the hem and cuff. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda, I’m not putting it on.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I haven’t asked you to. She get sit... lays it across him. GERDA (cont'd) Would you just relax...? The sooner I start, the sooner I finish. Einar yields reluctantly, as Gerda runs her fingers gentl down his face. Satisfied, Gerda returns to work. Einar’s breathing feels slightly laboured now. The dress weighs heavily. His head moves slightly, feeling it brush his neck. His fingers curl involuntarily around the beade cuff. The SOUNDSCAPE becomes heightened: the creak of Gerda’s easel, the jangling of her bracelets, the sound o the harbour, the wind in the ships’ riggings. These combi fill his head... until:

dialogues.speaker: ULLA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well hello, there! Einar starts... Ulla’s in the doorway, delighted, with a bunch of lilies. She starts to LAUGH, and because it’s Ul Gerda LAUGHS also. The dog YAPS, excited, confused. Einar disoriented. Gerda sees this, stops laughing, but... ULLA (cont'd) Oh, don’t worry my darling... She hands the flowers to him, kisses him: ULLA (cont'd) We're going to call you Lili... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Einar manages to laugh now as the dog runs BARKING in circles, Ulla’s delight banishing the day’s frustrations.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HARBOUR, NIGHT
dialogues.text: There are lights on in the Widow House.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STUDIO, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda closes the book she’s been reading, looks up to see Einar, working, engrossed. An almost trance-like state. S watches him a while, then approaches, rests her head agai his back. He’s comfortable with this, but works on.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Such concentration. Sometimes when you're working, I think you’re going to slip through the surface of the painting and vanish. He smiles a little. GERDA (cont'd) Sink into the bog. Like your friend’s kite when you were a boy.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Hans. It was Hans’ kite I crashed. Einar enjoys the memory for a moment. EINAR (cont'd) Poor Hans. He was so proud of it... I couldn’t believe he even let me have a turn...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: He’s probably still sitting on a rock, sobbing his heart out. Einar sets down his brush, turns toward her, away from hi work, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: He’s a dealer in Paris, peddling Old Masters to rich Americans.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Oh. So we don’t need to worry about Hans.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No we don’t. He takes her in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to disturb you.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: That's okay. I’ve finished. He kisses her. EINAR (cont'd) And don’t worry, I won’t disappear into the bog. He widens his eyes, surprised at his own realisation: EINAR (cont'd) The bog is in me, silly. She pushes him off, LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, LATER THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Einar’s in bed. Gerda pulls off her dress, looks round to see him watching her as she lays her stockings over the c beside her dressing table.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Can’t a man watch his wife get undressed? She goes to take off her lace-edged slip, self-conscious EINAR (cont'd) That slip is new...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You're very observant.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Leave it on... She hesitates, but Einar pulls back the sheet... Gerda ke the slip on, climbs in beside him. He strokes her body through the silk... EINAR (cont'd) It’s very pretty...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I might let you borrow it. Einar shrugs, rising flirtatiously to the challenge.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I might enjoy that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gerda LAUGHS, and Einar kisses her. She teases:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Oh really...? Is there something you’d like to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Why...? Is there something you'd like to know...? His fingers trace, quivering, over her...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No... I’m your wife. I know everything. Einar thrills, pulls her on top of him, a fresh passion, fresh risk about their union.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COSTUME SHOP, LATER THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: A champagne cork POPS. Ulla’s triumphant first night. She on magnificent form, working the room. Gerda’s portrait h in pride of place. Gerda and Einar chat with a group that includes their friends NIELS and ELSA. Ulla swoops in, WHISPERS something in Gerda’s ear. Gerda’s eyes register delight as she looks across at two young men on the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Both of them...?

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: And at the same time! Einar laughs. Gerda shakes her head. ULLA (cont'd) Married people are so delightfully easy to shock.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: We just pretend to be shocked because it encourages you.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: I know. That’s why you’re the only couple in my party for the Artists Ball...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Oh, I know Einar hates it, but he’1l have to bear with us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: She can go without me.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Gerda without an escort? It would be a scandal.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda loves a scandal.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You've had too much champagne. Niels and Elsa hear this, tune in...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Look at the way she dresses, flaunting her ankles. An invitation to corruption.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I don’t think anyone is likely to be corrupted by seeing my ankles.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I was. The group laughs delighted by Einar’s buoyant mood. EINAR (CONT'D) (cont’d) The first time we met, I was leaving the Academy, and she was on the steps, flaunting said ankles... And she propositioned me!

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Is that true?!

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It was a dare. But when I said hello to him, he actually blushed! He was so shy! So I asked him out.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: And you said yes - Einar scrutinises Gerda.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: She made me. She seemed so sure.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I was sure. I still am.

dialogues.speaker: NIELS
dialogues.text: Oh please - enough! Elsa elbows him, turns to Gerda. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: No - what was it about him? Gerda looks at Einar.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I don’t know... She remembers, drawing Einar into the recollection. GERDA (cont'd) But we went for coffee, and after, I kissed him... and it was the strangest thing... it was like kissing myself. A look between Einar and Gerda, a connection crackling.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Well these two won’t be staying much longer...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Unmarried people are so delightfully easy to shock. She and Einar smile, make their way towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Einar comes in, Gerda’s already in bed. He starts to undress, turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Turn it back on. He looks at her. She shrugs, smiles - it’s her turn, afte all... He turns it back on, a little awkward now, undress in front of her. She sees this, toughs it out, watching h anyway. GERDA (cont'd) Were you really corrupted by my ankles? Einar wears just his shirt now, begins to unbutton.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You were shameless.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I still am. Einar peels off his shirt. Underneath, he wears Gerda’s l edged slip. Gerda GASPS slightly... Einar has outdone her with this imaginative twist. But she rises to the occasio Feels the fabric against his body. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Beautiful shameless Gerda... She traces her fingers across his chest, challenged, arou

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, MORNING
dialogues.text: Einar asleep, a SCRATCHING sound in the background. We se quick charcoal strokes on paper, Gerda wrapped in Einar’s dressing gown, at the side of the bed. She’s fascinated, suddenly able to see the femininity of his features, play with it, creating a revised Einar... His eyes open...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Did I wake you? He raises his eyebrows, entertained. What does she think? She smiles, carries on working. GERDA (cont'd) Sorry... I couldn’t sleep.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Wondering about things.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: What things?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Wondering if we made a baby last night. Einar smiles, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: What d’you think? Gerda shrugs, keeps sketching.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Wondering when you got so pretty.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Oh, I was always pretty, you just never noticed. Gerda LAUGHS, keeps working.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STUDIO, A WEEK LATER
dialogues.text: In the studio, Einar looks at the sketches Gerda has made him, darkly fascinated. He hears Gerda come in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: In here... takes off her coat. Gerda comes in, puts down her workbag, Gerda’s a little self- Einar’s still looking at the sketches. conscious... EINAR (cont'd) These are good.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Do you think? He nods, absolutely serious. Gerda absorbs this, gratifie GERDA (cont'd) Well thank you. Thank you. Gerda goes out to hang up her coat, calls - GERDA (cont'd) I had coffee with Ulla. about the Artists’ Ball. She asked Einar draws breath to protest, but: GERDA (cont'd) Don’t worry - I told her no.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You should go, you enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: With you I enjoy it. Einar feels guilty.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Look - it’s good to be seen things. I understand that. at those

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: And that’s why you hate them. Gerda shrugs - she gets it. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I feel as though I’m performing myself.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Giving them your Einar Wegener. Exactly. Gerda looks at him a moment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GERDA (cont'd) Why not give them something different, go as someone else? She tilts her head. A look between them... this is a departure... Einar hesitates a moment...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Did you have someone in particular in mind? A mischievous smile spreads across Gerda’s face... she st to laugh, Einar begins to understand... laughs along... EINAR (cont'd) No - that’s outrageous!

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You'd be very convincing... You might even enjoy it... Einar marvels at her... she’s only half-joking.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, EVENING
dialogues.text: Gerda sweeps a layer of foundation over Einar’s face. Whe she’s done, he opens his eyes. Gerda’s taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You'll have to shave closer. Einar takes in his blanked-out face in the shaving mirror Gerda goes to apply eyeliner... GERDA (cont'd) Close your eyes... This is hard on someone else...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Here... Einar takes the crayon, draws a couple of pretty good lin EINAR (cont'd) How’s that? She marvels at his reflection. It’s bizarrely compelling.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Better than I ever manage. His reflection looks back. Gerda’s energy is up... She drapes her scarf around his neck... GERDA (cont'd) Oh, Lili! I want to sketch you... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She hurries him through to the studio... arranges cushion the chaise. GERDA (cont'd) sit! Einar sits - a distinctive pose.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Come on, Hvap! Hvappe jumps onto his lap. Gerda sketches quickly, absorb excited. She rearranges him, ‘feminising’ his poses.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Knee over... head up.. Look at those hands... relax... We see Einar at a series of angles... but his movements a more and more parodically feminine for Gerda’s entertainm The more he acts it, the more fun it is, until finally Ge scolds, still laughing: GERDA (cont'd) No, don’t make her a slut!

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: It’s your fault, you excite her. Gerda gets close to pin him still. His face closes on her

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Why, Miss Lili, you are forward...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You have no idea... He falls on her, laughing, passionate... Gerda responds, grabs a cloth and wipes his made-up face as he kisses her MONTAGE BEGINS -—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Gerda’s work around the room, now, depicting ‘Lili progress. Einar, at the mirror, plucks his eyebrows to be resemble the glamorous arch in Gerda’s sketches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einar and Gerda walk, a little way apart. He feels his wa into her gait, she checks back on his progress. 26/11/15  43 21.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HARBOUR, FISH STALL, DAY
dialogues.text: As Gerda buys fish, Einar is distracted, observing and copying the movements of the female customer beside him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda and Einar arrive. The stage doorman nods.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Morning, Thorbjorn... 43

dialogues.speaker: STAGE DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OPERA HOUSE, COSTUME SHOP, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda and Einar try on wigs, surreptitious, excited, adju one another’s choices. Then, a long line of almost identi shoes, beginning in tiny sizes but gradually getting bigg Einar grabs the last - biggest - pair. When he looks up, Gerda’s showing him a dress...

dialogues.speaker: INT. OPERA HOUSE, STAGE DOOR, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar and Gerda head out past the stage doorman, very ple with themselves. Gerda is several sizes fatter and taller she wears a wig with a hat on top. Hands stuffed into coa pockets hide bulky shoes. Thorbjorn looks up briefly from his newspaper. Then as the door closes behind Einar and Gerda, he looks up again - ? - MONTAGE ENDS -—

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, EVENING
dialogues.text: The Lili sketches depict a gamut of moods, face and postu already becoming iconic. Einar in the slip and the new shoes, practising his walk to settle his nerves. Hears th front door open - quickly calls:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I wondered where you were, it’s getting late. Gerda comes in...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: We have plenty of time. I bought these... Einar takes the stockings with interest. Gerda watches, entertained at his enthusiasm, but a little apprehensive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GERDA (cont'd) Einar, are you sure about tonight? Einar looks up, surprised. Nods, without hesitation. Gerda’s a little taken aback at his enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET NEAR CANAL, NEAR ROYAL ACADEMY OF ARTS, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Dancing light and sound - up ahead, we see a glamorous, eclectic gathering: the fun-loving, the arrogant, the eccentric, the bourgeois - all rubbing shoulders on their way to the Royal Academy. Two pairs of women’s feet in step: Gerda and Einar, appro the melee. Then Gerda realises Einar has slowed, dropped back behind her. She turns to see him transformed in a chiffon dress with a linen sailor’s collar and cuffs...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: What is it...? Einar’s eyes shine animated. He cuts an ungainly figure, the impression is more confusing than jarring.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Am I pretty enough? Gerda’s surprised by the sincerity of the question.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Of course you are... He takes Gerda’s hand and she pulls closer.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’ll never be as pretty as you. Gerda studies the features, the fire behind the eyes. An intensity she had not been expecting... something new... charged moment... Gerda’s genuinely moved... but then Einar/Lili laughs, breaks away... leaving Gerda with a be of emotion that doesn’t belong anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROYAL ACADEMY OF ARTS, STAIRCASE, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda and ‘Lili’ mingle with the crowd. A VOICE rings out

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: My darling! A flicker of fear in Lili... until Gerda interposes herse

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Ulla, let me introduce... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ulla’'s eyes snag for a moment as they search the familia face and realisation dawns. Delight floods her face. Then

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: It’s Lili...!

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: That's right. Einar’s cousin from Vejle...

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: My dear, you're exquisite... She LAUGHS, thrilled, exchanges a look with Gerda. Lili’s eyelashes flutter, a picture of shyness as Ulla summons t rest of her party - revelling in their shared secret... ULLA (CONT'D) (cont'd) In - let’s go in... Gerda and Lili - holding hands - join the crush:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: You won’t leave me, will you...? Gerda looks down at Einar/Lili’s grip on her hand.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: (sincerely) No. No, never. She squeezes the hand and they press forward together.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROYAL ACADEMY OF ARTS, GREAT HALL, NIGHT
dialogues.text: A spectacular event. An orchestra plays and people dance. Ulla’s party drink and laugh. Gerda and Lili hang back a little, observing. There’s a circle of men in tuxedos nea One glances across at Lili. Lili looks away, blushing.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: People are looking.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Well you're a pretty girl, you'll have to get used to that. But she sees Lili’s really uncomfortable. GERDA (CONT'D) (cont’d) It’s fine. You're just feeling self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gerda - ! They spot Elsa across the crowd... Lili shrinks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Go and talk to her...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No, I‘’1l stay with you...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Go. I’ll be fine. Go before she comes over here... Gerda reluctantly crosses the room and greets Elsa warmly But by the time she glances back, Lili has gone. Lili sits at the edge of the dancefloor on a bench carved with mermaids, a nerve fluttering in her cheek. We see a young man, HENRIK SANDAHL, study her closely - closely en to see she is not everything she appears, but this only s to intrigue him. He sits beside her. Lili self-consciousl takes a notebook from her bag, begins to jot things down. Henrik leans in, his raven hair in Lili’s peripheral visi leans forward until Lili’s refusal to engage becomes comi

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Are you a reporter? Lili looks up.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: (flatly) No.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: A poetess...? Lili packs up the notebook and hurries away... Finds a corridor, leading off the hall - quieter, darker... Lili feels her way along the wall, relieved to be in the cooler air, away from the party. As her eyes adjust to th darkness, she sees a couple kissing in an alcove. A flash the woman’s white thigh, as the man pushes up her dress. Lili turns away, discomfited, walks straight back into Henrik. HENRIK (CONT'D) (cont'd) Do you know the story of this oak tree?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Mm...? Henrik indicates a tree outside, behind Lili...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: They say if you eat its acorns you can make a wish and become anyone you want for a day. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Einar’s reaction flashes through Lili’s facade.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Why would they say that...? Henrik bows, entertained by the effect he’s had...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Henrik Sandahl. At your disposal. A moment’s hesitation, then:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Lili...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Are you here with someone, Lili?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Yes - my cousin’s wife.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Who’s your cousin? Lili hesitates, turns back:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Einar Wegener. He’s a painter.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Rather a good one. Better than most people think.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Most people our age at any rate.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Well.... She makes to leave again, but:

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Don’t go back in. It’s cooler here. Besides, I’m a romantic.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Oh really...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: I prefer the shadows and... Lili steals a look at him. He lowers his voice... sincere (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HENRIK (CONT'D) (cont'd) I don’t mean to presume, but I’ve been watching you. A tremor of panic runs through Lili... HENRIK (CONT'D) (cont'd) I think you might be the same. Henrik holds out his hand. Lili looks at it, a sense of connection she can’t understand, previously unimaginable. Then, trembling, Lili reaches out and rests her delicate, manicured hand in Henrik’s... and suddenly her nerves are completely steady. Henrik leads Lili along the corridor, away from the hall...

dialogues.speaker: INT. ROYAL ACADEMY OF ARTS, GREAT HALL, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Noisier and smokier now, too much aquavit drunk, the gues little out of focus. Gerda scans the dishevelled crowds, concerned - no sign of Lili. Suddenly, Ulla’s at her side

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Have you seen Einar? I can’t find him.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Of course you can’t, he isn’t here! Ulla and Gerda laugh... Ulla raises her glass... more fun But Gerda excuses herself, and continues looking...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROYAL ACADEMY OF ARTS, LIFE-DRAWING ROOM, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lili and Henrik sit on a bench in the lee of a sculpted classical nude. Lili’s cheeks burn. Henrik is clearly fascinated. The slight sense of playacting between them o heightens their excitement.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: You're different from other girls. Lili scoffs gently.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: That’s not a very original line.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: It’s true. You’re old fashioned. Lili takes Henrik in, decides to continue...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Provincial. I’m new to the city. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: No, it’s more than that. I feel I'd need to ask permission before I kissed you. A bolt of something goes through Lili. Her eyes sink, dra and repulsed, to Henrik’s lips. She can hardly breathe...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: I probably ought to find Gerda. She heads back toward the corridor... Henrik grabs her ha

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Why don’t you tell her I’11l walk you home...?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: She wouldn’t like that... He advances, his body pressing against her, commanding, holding her fixed in the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Lili... Lili pulls away, flustered, aroused...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: Einar might be waiting up... he wouldn’t like this...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t he...?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Lili... He steadies her... repeating her name... HENRIK (CONT'D) (cont'd) Lili... Lili. Three times a charm... We see something shift in Lili... Henrik senses it... He kisses her. When he releases her s gasps, and he kisses her again, finds his passion returne this time... When she finally catches her breath she can’ look at him...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: You didn’t ask permission...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: I couldn't risk you saying no. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Standing in the corridor, by the oak, Gerda watches, stun as Lili clutches Henrik’s arm, looks suddenly faint, upse Lili looks down, confused and then panicked. Blood pours from her nose, down the front of her dress... she’s appal HENRIK (CONT'D) (cont'd) What’s happened..? Let me... Henrik tries to find a handkerchief... Then sees Gerda approaching... He pulls away from Lili... HENRIK (CONT'D) (cont'd) I’m sorry I don’t know what... Lili holds out her arms to Gerda. Henrik steps back... Ge reaches Lili, quickly takes her weight... Gerda wraps her scarf around ‘Lili’, who now looks like Einar in grotesqu drag, smeared with make-up and blood.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Quickly, lean on me... Henrik watches, and onlookers stare as Gerda supports Ein out of the ball... They stumble, clinging together, asham

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: Einar paints. In a smart male suit. He is stiffly compose Gerda comes into the studio, in her nightclothes. Finds Einar deeply immersed. No trace of the night’s upset.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: How are you...?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You were late home last night, I thought I’d let you sleep. How was it? Did Lili have fun? Gerda’s stunned. Goes to the kitchen, upset. In the kitchen, Lili’s bloodied clothes are soaking in a bucket. Gerda struggles with the sight. Begins to make coffee, then... Gerda returns to the studio, watches Einar, anger buildin He allows it a while, then turns, braced to face her:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I think it would be better if Lili didn’t come here again.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Fine. I understand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You know what I would like to understand? Einar takes Gerda in... how furious, how shaken she looks GERDA (CONT'D) (cont’d) Exactly what happened between you and Sandahl last night?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: (quickly) Nothing. Gerda HUFFS, disbelieving. Einar repeats himself, angrily EINAR (CONT'D) (cont’d) It was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Did he know it was you? Einar blushes, shies away.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: It wasn’t as simple as that. It’s hard to explain... Gerda loses control, shouts at him:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I watched him kiss you, Einar, so could you please make an effort?! Einar’s shocked, ashamed. He takes stock, then quietly:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: He may have known who I was. But I wasn’t always... me. There was a moment when I was... just Lili. And I think he could see that. Do you see? Gerda struggles to comprehend this shift in the landscape

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: But Lili doesn’t exist. We made her up.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: We were playing a game!

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I know we were... but then it changed... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gerda’s mind reels, panic rises...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: This is absurd. We need to stop. Make it stop Einar. With genuine anxiety:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’m going to try... She goes, still distressed, leaving Einar alone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WIDOW HOUSE, EARLY MORNING, TWO WEEKS LATER
dialogues.text: The Chinese Laundress RINGS her tiny BELLS along the stre

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, MORNING
dialogues.text: The Lili portraits are gone. Einar regards a canvas. Fail to paint. In the kitchen, Gerda chops vegetables, throws them in a pan. She hovers in the doorway to the studio.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Another headache?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: It’s nothing... She goes back into the kitchen again...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Gerda returns to chopping.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Maybe you should see a doctor. Einar grows agitated.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda... I’m fine. Gerda looks round to see Einar now in his coat. He quickl collects a small suitcase, goes out, leaving Gerda to fre

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OPERA HOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: No lights on, no signs of life. 26/11/15  31.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OPERA HOUSE, STAGE DOOR, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar passes through, nods amiably to the familiar doorma

dialogues.speaker: INT. COSTUME SHOP, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar turns on the lights, quickly pulls off his coat. He leans forward, bracing against the bench, looks in the mirror. There’s a desperation about him. But now he sees: the front of his shirt gapes - reveals a cleavage, formed his rounded shoulders. Einar is compelled... nervously unbuttons his shirt to the waist and leans forward again. The effect is startling. He traces the shape of his ‘breasts’ with trembling hands. With a new urgency, he quickly strips off shirt, trousers terrified that someone might catch him, yet driven to pre on. He pulls off his underwear, returns to the mirror, pu his cock back between his legs, squeezing his thighs tigh until he has an approximation of a vagina. He rounds his shoulders, takes in the arresting transformation, breathl with excitement, terror. A sense of impending inevitable transgression. He opens his case. A carefully folded silk package unfurl into a dress, brushes against his skin.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STUDIO, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda sits in the chair looking out of the window, face s against terror, her sketchbook closed in her lap, broodin pressure building. She opens the sketchbook: Lili...

dialogues.speaker: INT CAFE ON CANAL, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar/Lili arrives inside a cafe, pushes back a headscarf see Henrik waiting at a table. He quickly stands when he spots Lili - who is consumed with shyness, real fear.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: I didn’t think you'd come. Lili settles in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: No. Nor did I.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STUDIO, LATER
dialogues.text: Gerda begins to sketch, almost afraid to begin. But her energy gathers and there is soon anger and desire in the as she conjures a Lili with dark erotic potential, a fren relationship with the subject developing... 26/11/15  32.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STUDIO, EVENING
dialogues.text: Gerda lies on the chaise, exhausted. Hears the door, does move. Einar appears, in his overcoat. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I thought you might not come back.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: That’s absurd...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Is it? Einar can hardly bear the question... feels terrible, wra his arms around her. Then sees, at an angle, in the half- light, the new Lili picture. A nude with female hips and breasts. A slash of red mouth. A cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ART DEALER'S OFFICE, A MONTH LATER, DAY
dialogues.text: A door opens and Gerda sits up - a THIN YOUNG MAN appears

dialogues.speaker: THIN YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: He won’t be much longer. Gerda sits back, too pessimistic to feel nervous.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ART DEALER'S OFFICE, HALF AN HOUR LATER
dialogues.text: Rasmussen studies a series of Gerda’s portraits, his mout puckered with poorly disguised distaste. Gerda steels herself to withstand the humiliation.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: I just... I don’t know... And then he sees the Lili nude. He’s suddenly intrigued.. RASMUSSEN (cont'd) The model...?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Einar’s cousin.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: Yes, the resemblance is... Rasmussen’s mind races. RASMUSSEN (cont'd) Are there others...?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: A series back at the studio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rasmussen licks his lips, excited but uncertain...

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: These are different... For these, I don’t know... there may be a market. Gerda has to confirm what she’s heard:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You're taking them.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: Well, yes... He’s surprised as she is.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HENRIK'S HOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: Lili hurries past the endless orange facades of a long ro terraced houses, Gerda’s embroidered wrap flying in the w behind her. Knocks at a door, breathless...

dialogues.speaker: INT. HENRIK'S HOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: Henrik welcomes Lili at the open door...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Come in... He closes the door against the world. Lili takes in the space. She’s delighted by it -

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I don’t have long... Gerda’s seeing Rasmussen. Henrik gestures for Lili to sit. She settles on the couch

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: I don’t like all these lies.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: She's very protective.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just tell her about us?

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I couldn’t do that... Lili seems a little panicked...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Sorry - I don’t want to upset you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sits beside her, settles her... HENRIK (cont'd) Come here... Lili lets herself be drawn closer to him... He strokes he face. Lili smiles, adoring. Henrik kisses her and she responds eagerly. His hand works its way down her body, between her legs. Lili squirms, uncomfortable. He persists... Lili bears it as long as she can, then gently

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: No... Henrik...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: No... Still in the moment of passion...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Einar... Lili recoils, stunned... astonished...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Come on... it’s alright... But Lili pushes him away, upset, bewildered...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I don’t understand... Henrik’s frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Einar... please... Lili panics, grabs her things to leave, horribly exposed.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you mean... I don’t know what you want...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: I want you!

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: No... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Yes... wait... Wait! Lili... Lili, come back... But Lili bolts, away and out through the front door, leav Henrik powerless, bereft. EXT. HENRIK’S HOUSE, DAY Lili rushes away, disorientated, along the row of garish facades, their orange now seeming grotesque...

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda struggles in with her portfolio. Heads for the kitc preoccupied by her experience with Rasmussen, is taken ab to see Lili at the table, Gerda’s embroidered wrap pulled tight about her. Then Lili looks round - her face swollen streaked with tears.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: (concerned) Are you alright...? Lili reaches out her hand and Gerda takes it...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: No... She holds Gerda at arms length. Takes a deep breath. EINAR/LILI (cont'd) I've been seeing Henrik Sandahl. Gerda reels, speechless as Lili clatters out, stumbling t the bedroom. Closes the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, KITCHEN, 20 MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Gerda sits - waiting. Finally, Einar comes back, in male clothing. Looks devastated.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I thought perhaps you knew.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: (barely audible) No.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You always seemed to know everything.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Not this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He nods. Gerda’s desperate confusion surfaces: GERDA (cont'd) So... are you in love with Sandahl? Einar’s appalled:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No - I love you, Gerda, only you. But Lili... Angry tears well in Gerda’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Why can’t you just be honest about this! But Einar’s angry too...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I'm trying! Gerda... please... I need you to believe me. You of all people to understand. Gerda shakes her head, unable to take this in... He looks her, desperate imploring... Gerda struggles:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Okay, I need you to tell me... when Henrik and ‘Lili’ are together, they what...? They kiss - we know that... Einar nods, awkward. Gerda steels herself: GERDA (cont'd) Has it gone beyond that?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No... No, Lili’s never gone further than that with aman. She... she wouldn’t... Gerda hears the implication... a bodyblow for her:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: There have been other men? Einar sits on the bed, bites down on something difficult:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: There was another, but it was a long time ago. A chill runs through Gerda... Einar gathers his courage. EINAR (cont'd) That boy Hans... back in Vejle. Gerda rubs her brow... everything’s happening too fast... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: EINAR (cont'd) Lili fell for him. And he kissed her. Just once. Einar darkens at the memory: EINAR (cont'd) But my father came in and he caught them... He knocked Hans down - he was so angry... Einar shakes his head... Gerda absorbs this. She looks up Einar looks pale, dark circles under his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to say. He breathes suddenly, against pain... GERDA (cont'd) What...? His eyes close, sweat forming on his brow.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry... He doubles over, clutching his stomach... moans horribly. EINAR (cont'd) I’m so sorry... I’m not feeling well. He tries to get up from the table, struggles...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Einar... what is this? What’s happening... She rushes to catch him as his legs give out under him... GERDA (cont'd) Einar... Einar...?

dialogues.speaker: INT. RADIUM INSTITUTE, DAY
dialogues.text: DR HEXLER closes the door firmly on Gerda, leaving her to fret in the waiting room. She settles for a long wait. INT. RADIUM INSTITUTE, HEXLER’S CONSULTING ROOM, DAY Hexler sits behind a desk. He’s brisk but kind.

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: So, you saw Dr Andersen after a bout of severe nosebleeds, which you have come to believe coincide (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEXLER (cont'd) with your stomach cramps, and on a monthly basis. Einar nods as he undresses. HEXLER (cont'd) How long have you been married?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Six years. Hexler takes notes as Einar continues stripping.

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: Children?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: Is there regular copulation?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Yes. Perhaps less now than...

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: Than before you started to dress as a woman? Einar’s shocked to hear this out loud. HEXLER (cont'd) Mr Wegener I’m a specialist. You may be embarrassed - I am not. HEXLER (CONT'D) (cont'd) So. Tell me about Lili. Where does she come from? Einar considers...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Inside me. Hexler seeks to inject a rational note...

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: You know the most likely explanation for all this is a chemical imbalance?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Really...?

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: Onto the bed. Einar climbs onto a raised doctor's couch. 38. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HEXLER (CONT'D) (cont'd) That would explain the pain, the confused state of masculinity and the infertility. Let’s hope it is that, because that we can cure. He switches on the bright examination lamp, places his pa against Einar’s lower abdomen.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RADIUM INSTITUTE, X-RAY ROOM, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar is strapped to a hospital trolley by a couple of nurses. Hexler watches through a window onto the room. Einar grasps Gerda’s hand, anxious, bewildered:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I don’t need to do this... There’s nothing wrong with me..

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Einar, that’s not true. The nurses nod to Gerda to leave.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: This can’t be right... The nurses wait...

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: (over tannoy) Radiation is a miracle, Mr Wegener: it destroys the bad and saves the good.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: He says it will be over very quickly... The nurses lead Gerda out... Einar takes in the alien machinery of the room. She watches helplessly through a tinted window as the X-ray machine begins to WHIRR. Hexle speaks into a funnel:

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lie still, Mr Wegener... The JUDDERING of the machine fills Einar’s head... an overwhelming assault on the senses... He closes his eyes, vanishes into himself.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RADIUM INSTITUTE, RECOVERY ROOM, NEXT DAY
dialogues.text: Einar drowses. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr Wegener...? Einar’s eyes blink open. They are dark, unreadable. HEXLER (cont'd) How are you feeling this morning? Einar considers the question for a moment, then —

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You’ve hurt Lili... Hexler reads the distress in Einar’s features. Einar clos his eyes again against the thought.

dialogues.speaker: INT. RADIUM INSTITUTE, CORRIDOR, DAY
dialogues.text: Hexler speaks to Gerda with new gravity.

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: I'm afraid your husband’s aberrant thinking persists. Do you keep a lock on your wardrobe?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Of course not. Hexler is nervous, but his tone is threatening.

dialogues.speaker: HEXLER
dialogues.text: Mrs Wegener, you haven’t been encouraging this delusion? You do understand that your husband's insane?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No, that’s not true... Hexler turns, walks away. Gerda’s furious... GERDA (cont'd) We trusted you, we came to you for help... But Hexler keeps walking without a backward glance.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HARBOUR, MORNING, TWO WEEKS LATER
dialogues.text: The early sun glances off the windows of the Widow House.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, MORNING
dialogues.text: The dog looks up from the bed. Runs over to greet Gerda w has just come in from the studio. We see now the dog is keeping Einar company. Gerda speaks in a hushed voice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I won’t be long.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about me, I’m fine. Einar is ashen, eyes glazed, surrounded by two dark circl EXT. STREET OUTSIDE RASMUSSEN’S GALLERY, DAY Gerda hurries past the window. Inside we can make out a b of Lili portraits on show.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ART DEALER'S OFFICE, COPENHAGEN, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda in Rasmussen's office. He’s unusually excited.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: Gerda! Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Away. Why, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: I sold the Lili portraits! Gerda is astonished... RASMUSSEN (cont'd) I have enough interest to mount a full show. Gerda’s amazed.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Well that’s wonderful...

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: And there’s more - I had a call from the Etienne Dufour Gallery - they would like to represent you in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: In Paris...?

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: You should go and see them. Gerda’s mind races...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Oh - I can’t travel just now...

dialogues.speaker: RASMUSSEN
dialogues.text: (firmly) Gerda, this is your moment. You’ve waited (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RASMUSSEN (cont'd) long enough... And these dealers can be fickle. Rasmussen tuts, disapproving.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STAIRS LEADING UP, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda, in a hurry, stops to collect the mail from the foo the stairs. There’s an art magazine, a personal letter, then, underneath an envelope from The Radium Institute... Hexler’s name on the back. Gerda freezes, then quickly op it, reads: “no choice... treated for perversion...". She struggles for a moment, panic rising, then folds the lett stuffs it in her jacket. A dark decision resolves itself Gerda’s face...

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, BEDROOM, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar’s asleep. Gerda packs, driven - sees Einar sit up.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Gerda gathers her courage.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I've been asked to exhibit in Paris...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: That’s wonderful...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Yes. We have to go. Rasmussen said it would make all the difference... Einar’s incredulous...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I can do that...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You can. I’11 take care of you...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: But surely there’s no rush...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: (furious) Can’t you just do this one thing for me? But by the time her outburst is over, she’s shaking...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda, what’s happening? Gerda looks at him. He’s waiting for the truth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I had a letter from Hexler...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: He wants to lock me up. Gerda holds his hands, utterly determined:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: But he won't. Everything will work out for us. Really - I know it. You just have to trust me...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I do... Gerda steels herself:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: So. Is there anything to take care of before we go? Anyone you need to tell? Einar considers a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No. Gerda nods, relieved. She kisses his cheek, resumes packi Einar concentrates on keeping breathing.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PARIS BY NIGHT
dialogues.text: A dazzling archetypal view of the Seine and its light-stu bridges, the Cathedral of Notre Dame a bold silhouette in background. VOICES come up, an EXCITED SOCIAL SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ETIENNE DUFOUR GALLERY, NIGHT, 6 MONTHS LATER
dialogues.text: An emphatically chic Parisian crowd admires a triumphant series of Lili portraits - a couple that we saw at Rasmussen's, and then several nudes, Lili imagined as an anatomically correct woman. A small group gathers round Gerda, their new star, and a still pale Einar.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Einar’s a painter too...

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN GROUP
dialogues.text: Oh? Do you exhibit in Paris?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I think my work is a little... introspective for French taste. An ENTHUSIASTIC AMERICAN WOMAN interrupts... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ENTHUSIASTIC AMERICAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me - is the model here? Einar rides it out. Gerda doesn’t miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No, she stayed behind in Denmark.

dialogues.speaker: ENTHUSIASTIC AMERICAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I was so hoping to meet her. Einar looks down, away, affected... Gerda’s swept off by gallery owner, leaving Einar in the company of the painti of his own banished self.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, BEDROOM, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda and Einar in bed, close, tenderness on both sides. Gerda gently kisses Einar, then begins to work her way do his torso. He closes his eyes, wills himself to let this happen... Gerda begins to fellate him... He struggles wit his breathing, intensely challenged

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda... please... I can’t. She continues... He’s overwhelmed with panic, pushes her EINAR (cont'd) No... The attempt at intimacy is over, failed. Einar’s full of guilt, distress. Gerda’s hurt, lost. Neither moves - emotional paralysis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda works on a self-portrait. Einar appears. Gerda hurries, to greet him, summons a playful mood, born of desperation.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Will you sit for me? Just as you are. We haven’t done that since art school. You enjoyed it then... He smiles. She strokes his face, encouraged. GERDA (cont'd) The teacher suddenly at the mercy of the student. You found it exciting. Gerda curls in to him. He gently extricates himself.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I... I can’t just now. I’m sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gerda feels ashamed, can’t help herself:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I miss you. I miss you working beside me. Einar hesitates, then admits:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I can’t remember the landscape any more. I can’t remember Vejle. Gerda struggles to adjust to this, then:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Well you could help me with this background. What does it need...? Einar looks at the painting, can hardly pull it into focu GERDA (cont'd) An kettlehole lake? A farmhouse, far off? He gently stops her -

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Gerda... He’s not going to do it. Turns away, goes out.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PARIS APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Gerda watches from the window: Einar in the street below, through the crowds until he’s out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RUE DE NUIT, DAY
dialogues.text: Different part of town, different atmosphere. Prostitutes the corner CLUCK indulgent as Einar passes. He looks self consciously about, enters a dingy house as another man co out. They barely acknowledge one another.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 22 RUE DE NUIT, 1ST FLOOR LANDING, DAY
dialogues.text: A hatch in a door slides open, and MADAME CARTON’s eyes f greedily from behind an iron grille.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 22 RUE DE NUIT, ROOM NO. 3, DAY
dialogues.text: The tiny room contains a chair and a bin. We hear GROANS an adjoining room. There are two small windows with black shades drawn. Einar settles, slowly lifts one of the shad Behind smudged glass, a worn-out girl in a corset and stockings grinds against a chair, sullen. Beyond her, we (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: another dark window, another man with his nose pressed against it. Einar studies the girl and gradually his body begins to mirror hers, a parody of female abandon. We see his reflection in the glass now, gradually eclipsing her... H breathes, an almost orgasmic GASPING breath of relief. INT. HANS OFFICE, QUAI D’ORSAY, PARIS, A WEEK LATER, DAY HANS AXGIL on the telephone. An impressively upholstered quixotic, appealing. The emphatically masculine room - da wood infused with Hans’ cigar smoke - overlooks a breathtaking view of the Seine. A sense of space, freedom

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Hey, he’s playing with us! He knows the price... Hans laughs, shakes his head. A quiet KNOCK and a secreta pulls a face around the door. Hans waves her away, impati HANS (cont'd) Look, I have to go. I have some Danish girl waiting to see me. But tell him we’ll find another buyer, no problem. He’s always the same! INT. HANS AXGIL’S OFFICE, RECEPTION, DAY Gerda’s immediately on her feet, her strong right hand stretched towards Hans, unavoidable. She’s no girl.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Hans Axgil.. He shakes her hand, intrigued. Gerda’s a little over-eage

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Thank you so much for...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Don’t thank me yet - I can’t represent you. I don’t handle any contemp...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Of course, no, I know that...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: The reviews for your show were terrific, but your work is way out of my...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Perhaps if you let me speak, things would be clearer...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hans stops, surprised. His secretary suppresses a smile.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Let you speak? Hans takes her in, the tough fragility of her. Smiles. HANS (cont'd) I’m a much better listener when I’m eating. He nods goodbye to his secretary, shows Gerda the door. EXT. STREET NEAR HANS’ OFFICE They hurry along the street, approach the restaurant...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t know why Rasmussen gave you my number, but I’m happy he did...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I asked him, I wanted to meet you, put a face to a name... Hans smiles, encouraged. He holds open the door to a smar brasserie. Gerda goes through ahead of him. As she does: GERDA (cont'd) I believe you were a childhood friend of my husband. Hans is left holding the door, alone.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) You have a husband?

dialogues.speaker: INT. SMART BRASSERIE, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda and Hans settle at a table. He nods to the sommelie

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: A bottle of the Mersault... The sommelier hurries away. Hans studies Gerda. Who is sh

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I’m married to Einar Wegener. Hans is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: To Einar? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You remember him?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Of course I remember him. My God - we were such friends. How is he? Hans is excited, a boy again. Gerda can’t help it, blurts

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: He told me that you kissed him once. Hans is taken aback... But his amazement shifts as it comes back to him... HANS (cont'd) Oh no! You’re right... We were fooling in the kitchen. Einar was wearing his grandmother’s apron... Hans laughs, amazed at his younger self: HANS (cont'd) We were just little boys, you know, playing around? Anyway, Einar just looked so pretty in that apron - I kissed him! Next thing I know, his father’s chasing me out. Hans shakes his head... HANS (cont'd) God - Einar. Hey - why didn’t he come today?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: He doesn’t know I’m here. I don’t think he'd like me asking for help. Hans’ eyes flash, focused. This is what she’s come for, t GERDA (cont'd) We don’t really know people here. And Einar’s... he’s lost his way. He’s not working. He needs someone to represent him - someone who knows, him. He needs a friend. Hans scrutinises Gerda, her pride at odds with her need. for the first time in her life, Gerda looks away, unable hold someone’s gaze. 26/11/15

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, KITCHEN, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda on her way out, a little anxious. Hears the racket Einar hammering at a frame.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Einar...? She finds him stretching a fresh canvas. He scarcely paus GERDA (cont'd) I’ve a new dealer coming over later. I'd like you to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I don’t want a new dealer. It doesn’t make sense for me. I’m hardly working anyway.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: That might change.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. I’m happy helping you. She goes to contradict, but he cuts her off: EINAR (cont'd) No dealer. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It’s Hans Axgil. Einar stops, astonished. GERDA (cont'd) Dinner at La Dauphine at eight, then back here to see the paintings. Gerda’s out of the door, leaving Einar alone with the new

dialogues.speaker: INT. LA DAUPHINE RESTAURANT, NIGHT
dialogues.text: An intimate place by the Pont Neuf. An empty chair at the table. Gerda and Hans wait. Hans smokes.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You know, Einar’s still stricken with guilt about crashing your kite.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: It was handmade, and I've had it since I was four! I’m glad you reminded me. I'’1l tease him about that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No - it’s too cruel.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: If he ever gets here. Perhaps he doesn’t want to see me?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No - no, it’s not that. We should order without him.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Does he abandon you often?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Of course not! Hans is surprised at her strength of reaction.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I was joking. A waiter stands over them, amplifying the moment.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARAIS STREET, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Hans’ car rolls down the street.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda takes out keys to open the apartment door...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I can come back another time, if you think Einar would prefer it...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Really. He’s expecting you... and it will do him good... But they’re both a little apprehensive as they enter. GERDA (0.S.) (cont'd) Einar...? Gerda noses into the living room, Hans following. He spot painting - his face brightens -

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I know this... the fjord at Vejle... not far from our houses!

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Yes, Einar painted it just before we left... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She goes ahead of Hans, sees: Lili on the chaise, in imitation of a pose in a painting on the wall behind her. dangerously charged, her cheek flushed, eyes shining. A t with crystal glasses. GERDA (cont'd) Lili... Gerda reorientates herself in the proceedings, turns to H who stands struggling to make sense of the scene before h GERDA (CONT'D) (cont’d) Hans, may I introduce Lili Wegener - Einar’s cousin from home. Now Lili’s up, her hand held out. Hans takes it...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: You can’t imagine how happy I am. He holds on to her hand, instinctively kind... LILI (cont'd) We met before in Vejle, but you probably don’t remember... Hans is utterly wrongfooted...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Can I take your coat Hans?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Of course... He comes to, allows Gerda to relieve him of it. She takes away. Lili continues, frighteningly animated...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: A digestif, Hans? It’s so chilly all of a sudden. I feel the cold these days. I don’t know why...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Thank you. Hans sits, but his eyes wander to the portraits that are ranged around the room. A kaleidoscope of Lili.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry Einar couldn’t be here. He told me: in Vejle you were his great friend. Both always plotting to getting away!

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: That’s true... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Such a tedious place! He said you’d sit and look out together, beyond the fjord.. to the sea... to the future.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Oh, we had big dreams...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: And you were the only one who let him paint in peace, who told him it was alright to be a painter. Gerda returns to the room. Hans searches Lili’s face for remains of his old friend Einar.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: He... used to sketch my portrait. Take a stone and draw me on the rocks at the side of the road. Gerda turns to Hans:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I didn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Would you like to see more of Einar’s work...?

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Do we have any? Gerda’s surprised, unsettled by the question.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, Lili...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Oh, but couldn’t we see it another time? I so want to hear more from Hans... Hans, are you married?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Why not? Gerda flinches, but: LILI (cont'd) He doesn’t mind, do you...? Gerda looks helpless. Hans takes over: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I've... been on my own a long time now. I’m too set in my ways.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I think marriage is the single thing we should all hope for in life.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Really? Lili looks utterly buoyant...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: It creates someone else, more than just the two of you. It would be terrible never to know that... Her expression crumbles... Hans looks to Gerda...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Lili... Lili’s dissolving...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Excuse me. She hurries out towards the bedroom, clearly in distress. Hans struggles to comprehend the situation...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You... you ought to go...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: No - let me help... She turns, holds Hans’ hands... the intimacy, intensity o connection surprises him:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Please - please - I’m sorry... He resigns himself to leaving... as he reaches the door:

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Goodnight Lili...

dialogues.speaker: LILI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Goodnight... Hans lets himself out. In the bedroom, Gerda, still shocked, looks at Lili - bewildered, afraid, head hanging. LILI (cont'd) I don’t think he noticed anything, do you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: No, I think I got out just in time.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Sleep now. We’1ll talk more tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Can I borrow a nightdress? Gerda’s shocked.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No... we’ve never done that. Lili’s never spent the night... Einar confesses:

dialogues.speaker: LILI
