dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter what I wear. When I dream, they’re Lili’s dreams... Gerda struggles to accommodate this, very reluctant... bu she gives in, nods. What else can she do?

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, BEDROOM, LATER
dialogues.text: Gerda in bed. Lili’s sleeping head on the pillow next to her, where Einar’s once was. Gerda turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, BEDROOM, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda arrives to find Lili in a bright dress with matchin scarf. Shopping bags everywhere. Slight tension in the ai

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: A new dress...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: And this. Do you like it? She hands Gerda a bright scarf...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s perfect for you... Gerda hands it back. GERDA (cont'd) We're actually a little short of money at the moment. Lili hangs the scark back round Gerda’s neck, hardly miss beat: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I know, but now I’m back, I can sit for you again, can’t I...? That worked well before, Gerda, didn’t it...? Lili and Gerda take each other in, on a new footing...

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, STUDIO, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda paints Lili who has found a new stillness. A more serious spirit beneath the translucent skin. A sense of h growing into herself. We see on the wall now a number of double portraits, tell the story of a developing negotiation - Gerda and Lili depicted together, with a sense of close friendship or a wistful attempt at coupledom. Now Gerda paints with Lili advising... The two collaborating, a sense of shared vision. And throughout, we see Lili fully imagined as a woman, an increasingly idealised one - unrealistically lovely...

dialogues.speaker: INT. ETIENNE DUFOUR GALLERY, RAINY NIGHT, ONE MONTH LATER
dialogues.text: Another show of ‘Lili’ paintings. A lot of the paintings the two as a couple, but Gerda is here alone. She feels i She works the room, determined, then sees Hans, across th crowd. Misses a beat. They make their way toward one another. An awkward social kiss. Gerda’s unusually brittl

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: It’s a good crowd.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: She's a popular girl. Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Thank you for asking me. I thought you'd forgotten all about me.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: We've been busy.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Is Einar here?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Einar hates this kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: That’s a shame. For you, I mean. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I don’t mind. Hans wonders about this... lets it go.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Is he well...?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: He’s excited. We have an old friend coming to town: Ulla Fonsmarck, the dancer. Do you know her?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. Could I take you to dinner? To celebrate? Someone ought to.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No. Thank you. Hans absorbs this, regroups.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Gerda, have I offended you?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Gerda... He rests his hand on her arm, pressing for some honesty.. Gerda’s cornered, the heat of the room, the nearness of H

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I am still Einar’s wife. She brushes past him, into the crowd. A MAN’S VOICE calls

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Hans! Hans’ social mask slips quickly back into place. Later: CLOSE ANGLE on Gerda, watching as a flirtatious wo WHISPERS something in Hans’ ear. His eyes widen, he LAUGH Gerda looks away. Quickly sets down her drink and moves through the crowd toward the door... A GALLERY EMPLOYEE frets as Gerda pulls on her coat.

dialogues.speaker: GALLERY EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: At least take an umbrella...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I'm fine, honestly... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GALLERY EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: If you just wait a minute someone will drive you... But Gerda’s out in the rain, the party still in full swin

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, KITCHEN, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda lets herself in, breathless. Lili’s just arranging supper table, is surprised to see Gerda home so early...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Gerda...? Oh - you’re wet through. Gerda seems angry. Lili tries to stay buoyant... LILI (cont'd) Did it go well...? Tell me - how was it?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You'd know if you’d been there. Lili falters, then points to the table... set with flower

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I’ve made us a supper...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You should have come.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: A little sort of celebration...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: This is not how it goes! We do these things together!

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: That's you and Einar. Gerda’s pent-up frustration begins to boil over...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Stop playing that stupid, stupid game!

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Don’t you say this is a game!

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You should have been there!

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: How could I be? Look at me! This further enrages Gerda - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Not everything’s about you! Gerda is suddenly overwhelmed with emotion - GERDA (cont'd) I need to see Einar. Lili flinches, shakes her head, touches Gerda, tender.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Let me help... Gerda cuts her off sharply, desperation building:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I need my husband. Just get him!

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I can't... Lili’s eyes cloud. Gerda moderates, already losing hope..

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I want to talk to my husband. I want to hold my husband. I need him. Can you get him? Can you at least try? Lili’s pained by the request. Her eyes plead, but Gerda’s desperate, won’t give up. Finally Lili shakes her head, desperately sorry. Gerda turns on her heel. The front doo BANGS as she heads off into the night, leaving Lili alone deeply sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda sits in the dark, watching the rain on the pond. EXT. HANS AXGIL’S APARTMENT, NIGHT Hans heads for his building, is amazed to see Gerda on th front step...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Gerda... what is it? She gets to her feet... HANS (cont'd) You're soaked... He goes to comfort her, and she embraces him... initiates desperate snatched kiss before breaking away, upset. Hans pursues her... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HANS (cont'd) Gerda... wait...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Wait... He hurries to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, BEDROOM, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lili transitioning to Einar. It happens awkwardly, and wh Einar looks in the mirror, he’s baffled by his reflection I/E. HANS’ CAR/RAINY STREETS, NIGHT Hans drives an exhausted Gerda, pulls up outside their building.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Will you be alright?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I'm always alright. He reaches for her hand. Gerda stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: For God’s sake. Take some kindness where you can. He keeps hold of her hand. Gerda feels the warmth of him. Her eyes fill.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Einar always comes back in the end. He always has...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Maybe this time... he just can’t.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Gerda shakes her head, gently rejecting Hans. GERDA (cont'd) I’ve never not finished a painting, I don’t know how to give up. Hans smiles, rueful. Finally lets Gerda take back her han 26/11/15  60.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, BEDROOM, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda appears in the doorway. Sees Einar sitting in the chair by the bed. She’s struck by how vulnerable he looks He looks up, and with genuine regret:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR/LILI
dialogues.text: I don’t think I can give you what you want... He looks away, ashamed. It’s unbearable. Gerda approaches him. He looks like Lili dressed as Einar. EINAR/LILI (cont'd) I don’t know how long we can go on like this.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No. She pushes in beside him. Einar/Lili lies in Gerda’s lap. They hold each other into the night.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OPERA GARNIER, PARIS, TWO WEEKS LATER, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Establishing shot.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OPERA GARNIER, STAGE, NEXT DAY
dialogues.text: Einar watches a group of dancers rehearse on stage. Sitti in the stalls, Gerda and Ulla are talking, as Ulla unbind her feet. We see callouses over the knuckles of her toes, toenails broken and sore. She’s used to this.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: He needs to see someone. Gerda checks Einar’s well out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You know what happened with Hexler.

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: But he’s so thin, Gerda...? There’s something wrong with him. Gerda looks across at Einar.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Lili watches her figure... Ulla lowers her voice -

dialogues.speaker: ULLA
dialogues.text: Look, there’s a doctor - he runs the Women’s Clinic in Dresden. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gerda’s face changes as she hears what Ulla’s telling her ULLA (cont'd) He’s interested in men like Einar. Men who are... different. Who are... confused. Gerda’s surprised. ULLA (cont'd) He’s often in Paris. Before Gerda can reply, Ulla is writing a name on a card ULLA (cont'd) Just talk to him? It couldn’t hurt, could it? - “Prof. Kurt Warnekros”. She gives the card to Gerda. Ge looks up at Einar. Finds him looking back, plainly exhaus

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, MORNING
dialogues.text: Gerda has made coffee. Einar comes in, dressed and with s energy.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Oh good... you’re awake... how do you feel? Einar nods - pretty good. She pours him coffee. GERDA (cont'd) Come.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I can’t - I have somewhere to go... He pulls on a jacket.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Where? He recoils from the question. Gerda gives up - GERDA (cont'd) I’m sorry - I don’t know how to hold on to you any longer.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I know. But I love you and I’m going to find an answer. 26/11/15

dialogues.speaker: INT. BIBLIOTEQUE NATIONALE, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar at a desk piled high with books. He reads, driven, fascinated. We see the books: The Normal and Abnormal Man Scientific Study of Sexual Immorality...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PARK, LATER
dialogues.text: Einar makes his way through the park. He looks bizarre in daylight, like a woman dressed as a man. He passes a coup of rough-looking younger men. One HISSES under his breath

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER MAN
dialogues.text: Lesbian... Einar looks round, amazed, almost amused at the mistake.. when the men recognise that Einar is - in fact - a man, t LAUGH, shocked. Einar keeps walking, conscious of the men shadowing him, making silly obscene noises and comments. Einar presses on, anger and anxiety building as the men pursue. Now the men pull level with him, jostle, one movi ahead and rubbing his crotch. YOUNGER MAN (cont'd) You speak English? Are you a boy...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGER MAN 2
dialogues.text: Or a girl...? The first Young Man leers and LAUGHS and then we suddenly his nose burst with blood as Einar’s fist connects. The t men are caught by surprise as he lashes out with terrific energy, but they regroup and then Einar’s down, fists and feet flying, the men beating him furiously, until they finally run away. INT. HANS AXGIL’S OFFICE, QUAI D’ORSAY, PARIS DAY Animated discussion between Hans and another man.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: But I’m worried that will be too late. I can’t hold the buyers much longer... Hans’ secretary puts her head around the door. He glances up, annoyed, but something in her face gives him pause. Behind her, a man appears... A beat before Hans recognise the badly swollen face. HANS (cont'd) Einar... 26/11/15  63. INT. HANS AXGIL’S OFFICE, BATHROOM Hans tenderly cleans Einar’s face with iodine.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You're good at this.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I boxed for a while.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Shame you weren't with me earlier. Einar smiles at his own humour, but it hurts too much. EINAR (cont'd) Sorry I’ve never been to see you before.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: That's alright. You’re here now.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I couldn't let Gerda see me this way. She has enough to put up with. Hans acknowledges the truth of this, carries on.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Let me know if you feel light-headed.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’m permanently light-headed.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: God, Einar, what’s happened to you? I don’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Ha - nor do I. But I don’t think it’s anything new... Even in Vejle...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Well I was different.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: It didn’t take much to be different in Vejle! Surely, that’s why we became friends? Einar nods, accepts Hans’ generosity. They take each othe in, the absurdity of their situation settling between the

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I wanted to thank you for looking after Gerda. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hans is slightly uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: It’s no great hardship.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’ve let her down.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: She doesn’t think that. Einar struggles a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Every morning I promise myself I’1l spend the whole day as Einar. But there’s so little Einar left.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: You need building up...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No. I think Lili’s thoughts. All the time. Even here, now, I’m having to work so hard just to... to be me. To be this. He gestures, hopeless. But Hans won’t be defeated.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: You think these things because you’re exhausted... Einar confesses.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I think sometimes about killing Einar. It’s only the thought that I’d be killing Lili too that stops me. Hans is appalled, struggles for words.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: You need to see someone. A doctor.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: No doctors. Hans lays his big hand heavily on his friend’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: 130 Yes, Einar. You have to try. 130 INT. DR BUSON’S CLINIC, ONE WEEK LATER, DAY Einar in a reclining chair, beside a pull-down chart of t human brain. He’s focused, engaged. BUSON seems excited. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUSON
dialogues.text: A confused state of identity. He snaps down a diagram of the frontal lobe. BUSON (cont'd) I drill small holes - here, here and here... He touches Einar’s forehead... Einar blanches, surprised. INT. DR MCBRIDE’S ROOMS, ONE WEEK LATER A CLOCK TICKS in the self-conscious reconstruction of Fre consulting room. MCBRIDE adjusts his pince-nez.

dialogues.speaker: MCBRIDE
dialogues.text: I've listened carefully and I’m afraid it’s not good news. From the couch, Einar waits for the diagnosis. MCBRIDE (cont'd) You’re a homosexual. Einar fails to stifle a bitter laugh.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ETABLISSEMENT HYDROTHERAPIQUE, ONE WEEK LATER, DAY
dialogues.text: Dr Mai observes Einar, fascinated, over tented fingers.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t really know what kind of help I need, but I can’t go on living without knowing who I am.

dialogues.speaker: DR MAI
dialogues.text: Mm... very good... Dr Mai nods vigorously, scribbles definitively onto a pad

dialogues.speaker: MAI
dialogues.text: Please excuse me a moment... He nods politely goes out, leaving Einar alone. Curiosity gets the better of Einar and he works his way to the desk looks at the pad. As the sun falls across it, he can clea see the imprint of a word: schizophrenic... Einar panics, grabs his coat...

dialogues.speaker: INT. ETABLISSEMENT HYDROTHERAPIQUE, CORRIDOR, DAY
dialogues.text: Dr Mai hurries down the corridor flanked by male nurses. 26/11/15  66. INT. ETABLISSEMENT HYDROTHERAPIQUE, DR MAI’S ROOM, DAY Dr Mai and the men look on, impotent, as the lace curtain floats at the window onto the courtyard. Einar has gone.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, STUDIO, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Gerda comes home. The place is in darkness. She startles. Einar’s been waiting for her. Gerda sits.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Do you think I’m insane?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Did a doctor say that?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I know we agreed no more... but look at me. She does - carefully, seeing Lili, just below the surface

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You’re not insane. Einar’s grateful. Gerda fights emotion... GERDA (cont'd) Did I do this to you? Einar doesn’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think if it hadn’t been for the paintings...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Oh no... no, no. You helped bring Lili to life, but she was always... she was waiting...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: But now she’s making you ill.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to do. The doctors can’t help me. Einar’s at the end of the road. Gerda broaches the subjec she most fears:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Do you want to try one more...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Einar is surprised. What does Gerda have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: INT. RESTAURANT, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda and Einar sit, both nervous. Opposite, Warnekros observes Einar closely. A nervous tension in the air.

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: So what do you think would explain what you've been experiencing Mr Wegener?

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Professor Warnekros... the fact is... I believe I am a woman inside.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: And I believe it too. Einar looks to Gerda, grateful to hear her say this out l

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: You probably think I’m insane. That we both are... Warnekros smiles. He lights a cigarette, taking his time.

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: Well, there are people who think that I’m insane. But I think you’re probably right. Einar’s amazed. Warnekros breathes, begins: WARNEKROS (cont'd) I’ve met another man like you. Einar grasps Gerda’s hand, filled with hope... WARNEKROS (cont'd) I pursued his case - against the wishes of my colleagues, of course. Warnekros considers a moment, then: WARNEKROS (cont'd) I told him I could operate. To make him fully a woman.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: Is that really possible? Einar and Gerda struggle to take in the idea.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: What happened to the man? Was the operation successful? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: It never took place. On the morning of the first operation, he ran away. He was too frightened.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t do that. Warnekros manages a grim laugh. Sounds a warning -—

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: Perhaps he was the smart one. The surgery has never been attempted before. Gerda tries to get a grip on things:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Professor Warnekros, what is this surgery...?

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: Two operations... The first to remove the male parts entirely. The second - once you were strong again - to construct a vagina. Gerda looks to Einar - Einar’s rapt. WARNEKROS (cont'd) An irreversible change, and a high risk of failure, of infection, complications. Warnekros’s hand waves through the air, suggesting the worst...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It’s too dangerous...

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: It’s my only hope. Gerda and Einar exchange a look. Warnekros observes.

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: I leave for Dresden at lunchtime tomorrow. He warns them, an unmistakably serious tone: WARNEKROS (cont'd) Mrs Wegener, I do believe I can help your husband. But he won’t be your husband when I’ve finished. 26/11/15

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRAIN STATION, MORNING
dialogues.text: A NOISY bustling platform. People rushing in all directio Einar checks his ticket, about to board the train. Hans a Gerda are with him, almost swept away by the tide of peop Hans carries his case. They find a space in the crowd. Einar strains at his starched collar - his suit is emphatically masculine.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I feel strange going dressed like this.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It’s important. Hans says the Germans will check your papers.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Don’t take any chances. You’re nearly there. Hans and Einar embrace, then Hans holds him at arms lengt

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I won’t be seeing you again.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: You know, I’ve only really liked a handful of people in my life and you’ve been two of them. Einar half-laughs. Hans twinkles. HANS (cont'd) Take care. Take care. The men part. Hans withdraws. Einar turns to Gerda. What can he say? They hold one another close, intensely privat

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I wish you’d let me come with you.

dialogues.speaker: EINAR
dialogues.text: I can’t. You love Einar. And I have to let him go. They kiss, an emotional parting. She removes her bright scarf.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Here, take this... He takes it, smiles, and boards the train - just in time. The air fills with steam and NOISE. Gerda raises her hand wave as the train pulls out, carrying Einar away. Einar fights tears as he moves off... Gerda runs alongside a little way, the gap that’s opening between them suddenly unbearable. And then... the train has gone. Gerda turns t leave, finds Hans waiting. She walks past him, bereft. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Gerda...? Let me give you a lift. She barely turns, hands stuffed firmly in her pockets.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I’m going to walk. She strides down the platform, trying to outpace the pain face set, body strong. She could walk like this forever.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRAIN COMPARTMENT, DAY
dialogues.text: Einar watches the scenery fly by outside.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, STUDIO, EVENING
dialogues.text: Gerda prepares a fresh canvas. INT. TINY BATHROOM ON TRAIN. Einar opens a document - his passport. Takes a long look

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Next stop, Dresden. Dresden is the 148 next stop...

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS APARTMENT, STUDIO, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda, charcoal in hand, the canvas before her, waits to begin. Then there’s a swift line on the canvas - the curv of a flank - conjures a nude Einar or Lili... Whatever na is attached to it now. She sketches the form of a body sh loves. Strong magic to keep it from harm.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET, DRESDEN, AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Lili walks into town, a high road that gives her a panora view of the river. INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, RECEPTION, EARLY EVENING

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Yes, my name is Lili, I’m here to see Professor Warnekros.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Lili what? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lili wonders, surprised at the question...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Oh... Lili Elbe. Yes. Like the river. The Receptionist nods. Writes it down.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Please take a seat... Lili settles... looks around. A sanctuary. For women. INT. WARNEKROS’S OFFICE, EVENING Lili sits with Professor Warnekros. Behind him, anatomica models of women’s reproductive parts, plastic foetuses.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Must I really wait?

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: It’s only a week, We need you to rest and gain some weight. We can’t risk an infection. Professor Warnekros rises, rests his hands on Lili’s shoulders, paternal. Lili pats his hand, tender, submissi WARNEKROS (cont'd) For what I’m attempting, you’ll need to be strong.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: This is not my body, Professor. Please take it away. EXT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, GARDEN, DAY Lili amidst other young women patients, many pregnant. Sh concentrates on balancing a teacup on her knee. A VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: URSULA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you think Spring will come early? Lili looks round. A delicate blonde, URSULA, sits nearby. URSULA (cont'd) I saw you looking at the crocuses.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Oh - yes. You’re having a baby. Ursula nods, cradles her round belly.

dialogues.speaker: URSULA
dialogues.text: And you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: No - I’m ill inside. But Professor Warnekros’s going to make me better. He’s operating tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: URSULA
dialogues.text: Will you be able to have children after? The question catches Lili by surprise, sets her thinking.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: URSULA
dialogues.text: I hope so. Lili smiles, full of optimism. INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, LILI’S ROOM, EVENING A particularly solicitous NURSE gives Lili a white pill.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: To help you sleep tonight. Later - Lili at the sink, wipes a washcloth over her face The water runs a peachy colour as powder and rouge rinse away. Lili looks in the mirror at Einar for the last time

dialogues.speaker: INT. PARIS CAFE, EVENING
dialogues.text: Hans smokes his cigar. Picks a speck of tobacco from his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Rasmussen called. The Dufour people want you in their group show. I like the idea. Gerda looks across at him, hasn’t heard anything.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: The Dufour Gallery? But Gerda shakes her head. Hans SIGHS, considers, then: HANS (cont'd) Gerda, why don’t you go...?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: He asked me not to. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: He wanted to protect you. You should be there. I'll go with you. Gerda turns on him:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No. If I go, it’ll be alone.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Now you’re sounding like Einar.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I am like Einar. Hans seethes, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do Gerda?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I want you to go away. Hans is surprised, hurt.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Really? Gerda looks down, fixes her eyes on a burn mark on the tabletop. She senses movement as Hans chair is pushed asi

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No, I’m sorry... But it’s too late. Hans is gone. INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, NEXT DAY Einar/Lili sleeps a deep sleep. We pull out to see the operating theatre around her, Warnekros prepped to begin. INT. PROFESSOR WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, CORRIDOR/LILI’S ROOM Warnekros escorts Gerda along the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: She only regained consciousness very briefly. We’re having to give her a great deal of morphine, of course, so that’s to be expected. As they reach Lili’s room, a CRY fills Gerda with fear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WARNEKROS (cont'd) It’s nothing, I assure you... Gerda is stunned to see Lili held down by ropes weighted sandbags. She looks terrible, grey-green, exhausted. A nurse administers morphine, another soothes.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: You mustn’t move Lili. It only makes it worse...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: (under her breath) My God... The nurse pushes a paralysed Gerda gently aside -—

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Excuse me... The nurse slips a mask over Lili’s face. She sucks gratefully at the numbing gas. Gerda comes to, galvanises herself, moves the nurse aside, takes hold of the mask.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I’ll do that. I’m here now. Don’t worry, I’m here... The nurse looks to Warnekros - he nods. She withdraws. Ge smooths Lili’s brow, determined, devoted. EXT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, GARDEN, TWO WEEKS LATER, DAY Lili dozes in her wheelchair. Gerda sketches. Lili smiles little but her eyes don’t open. Gerda notices, stops.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I can feel I’m getting better when I listen to your pencil. She opens her eyes. LILI (cont'd) You’ve always sketched me better than I was.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Have I...?

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: What you draw, I become. You made me more beautiful, now you’re making me strong. Such power in you. Gerda smiles. Lili reaches out and touches her hands. Lili’s eyes shine, full of anticipation. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LILI (cont'd) Shall we go back to Denmark then, Gerda? Shall we go home?

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, COPENHAGEN. STUDIO, 1 MONTH LATER, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda CRACKS the lock on the shutters, pushes them open, flooding the long-dark room with light. Outside, the bust harbour -

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Lili! Lili, you’re late... 166 Lili appears. She’s excited - dressed, made up... Gerda holds out a little pill-box. GERDA (CONT'D) (cont’d) So, these...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Every two hours. And I have to eat something first. I have a few macaroons in my bag all ready.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: And these, only if you need them. Lili salutes like a girl guide. Gerda marvels at her... s alive. GERDA (cont'd) Good luck. Lili leaves. Gerda breathes again. A new beginning.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET OUTSIDE THE WIDOW HOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: Lili makes her way down the street, her confidence slowly building. A man lifts his hat as she passes and she looks away, surprised and pleased. INT. FONNESBECH’S DEPARTMENT STORE, DAY Lili hangs on the glamourous Manageress’s instructions. F perfectly with the other painted dolls behind the perfume counter.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGERESS
dialogues.text: And remember, making a purchase at Fonnesbech’s is not merely shopping. It’s an experience! You lived in Paris, yes?

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Oh yes... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MANAGERESS
dialogues.text: Let everyone know! The store is a stage - we are here to perform. Lili looks out over the cut-glass bottles and endlessly reflecting surfaces, thrilled ... INT. FONNESBECH’S DEPARTMENT STORE, DAY Lili at work. She explains to an older female customer:

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: And in Paris, a lady would never dream of spraying the scent directly onto herself. The woman listens, entranced by Lili’s animated lecture. LILI (CONT'D) (cont'd) No, you spray the air, see, and walk into it... Lili skips into the mist of scent. LILI (CONT'D) (cont'd) Voila..! Lili skips into the mist of scent. LILI (cont'd) You try... The woman is shy, but Lili’s enthusiasm is so infectious. Later: Lili rearranges the perfume bottles on the counter until they are perfectly aligned... a real satisfaction i the aesthetic endeavour. INT. FONNSBECH’S DEPARTMENT STORE Lili and her colleagues pour out of the store, demob-happ Lili offers them sweets from her handbag.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: It’s so unfair - you’ve got the sweetest tooth and the narrowest hips in the whole store...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 2
dialogues.text: How do you manage it, eating so much sugar?

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Oh, the trick is to eat nothing else... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They all LAUGH. Lili moves to go...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow! The Girl hurries into the arms of her waiting boyfriend. Lili watches, intrigued. Until -

dialogues.speaker: GIRL 2
dialogues.text: Lili - are you coming... And Lili rejoins the throng.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET RUNNING PAST CANAL, DAY
dialogues.text: Lili walks along the canals, savouring the journey. The s sparkles on the water, and all around people are meeting talking, a world of life that she finally feels part of.. INT. WIDOW HOUSE, GERDA’S SIDE OF THE ROOM, NIGHT A quiet, dreamy atmosphere. Gerda lies awake, watches Lil lamplit silhouette on the other side of the dividing shee Lili writes in her notebook. After a while:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You know one night last week, I had the strangest dream.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I dreamed you were getting married. Lili’s silhouette sits up...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Do you think I ever will...?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Who knows? So many strange things have happened. GERDA (cont'd) It’s not so long ago we were married... you and me. Gerda waits in the silence for some response.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: You and Einar.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I know it was Einar. But really it was you and me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They both absorb this idea... Lili’s silhouette waits a moment, then lies back down. Ge curls into herself.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAFE ON HARBOUR, DAY
dialogues.text: Lili passes the cafe on the Harbour as usual, glances ove Her footsteps slow... Sitting alone at a table is a famil face: Henrik looks up from his newspaper: Lili. He looks shocked... then delighted...

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: Is it really you...? Lili smiles...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I believe so. They begin to laugh, lit up with euphoria. Henrik hurries pull out a chair for Lili to sit down...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Lili and Henrik at a table together. Henrik is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: So what you’re suggesting is.. Lili tilts her head, waiting, pleased with herself... HENRIK (cont'd) That a doctor... Henrik glances around, lowers his voice... HENRIK (cont'd) ...intervened...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: To correct a mistake in nature. I have a passport to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: He made you a woman...? Lili bridles slightly, corrects him kindly -

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: God made me a woman. The doctor cured the sickness that was my disguise. Henrik pushes, still struggling. Lili’s confidence ebbs.. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRIK
dialogues.text: A real woman? The question hangs between them.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, STUDIO, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lili sits writing in her notebook, all seriousness. Gerda looks up from reading. Lili takes a pill, resumes writing

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You're going to need a new notebook if you carry on like this.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: When Professor Warnekros suggested I keep a diary... well, I thought I'd never have anything to write. But it helps, to make sense of things.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Perhaps I should try it. Lili almost smiles. GERDA (cont'd) Do you never think of painting? Lili’s surprised. GERDA (cont'd) You might be good at it.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I want to be a woman, not a painter.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Well, people have been known to do both. I'd be curious to see what you painted, that’s all. Sometimes it’s hard to know what’s in your... Lili takes a pill, testy. Gerda’s can’t help herself: GERDA (CONT'D) (cont’d) Didn't you just take one of those a minute ago?

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Gerda, I know what I’m doing. Gerda backs off. LILI (CONT'D) (cont'd) I’m going to get some fresh air. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lili gets her coat and Gerda’s wool wrap. But as Lili hea for the door - LILI (cont'd) You know sometimes I wonder why you let me go through all this if you thought everything would be the same afterwards. Gerda’s wrongfooted...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I didn’t. But I promised Einar I'd take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: For goodness’ sake, Gerda - Einar is dead. We both have to accept that. You took care of me, now I have to take care of myself. I have to have a life of my own. And you need to do the same. Lili calls the dog, heads for the door, and is gone. Gerd is left alone to process this exchange...

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, NEXT DAY
dialogues.text: In the studio, Gerda reorganises, determined - paints, brushes, solvents everywhere. She has already taken down most of the sketches from her studio wall. It is blank - clean sheet. She considers...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PHONE KIOSK ON HARBOUR, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda paces, exercised, all nervous indecision. Resolves enter the booth... We hear a PHONE RINGING. INT. HANS AXGIL’S OFFICE, PARIS, RECEPTION, DAY The Receptionist at her desk, on the phone:

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Yes, in London... Is it urgent? Should I could ask him to..?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PHONE KIOSK ON HARBOUR, DAY
dialogues.text: Gerda, on the phone, disappointed, wrong-footed.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Oh, no that’s fine. Just tell him... just say... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She struggles to compose a message. GERDA (CONT'D) (cont’d) It’s a beautiful day in Copenhagen. She hangs up, discomposed. Feeling like a stupid teenager

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda passes the fish stall, greets the female fishmonger then sees Lili, up ahead, on Henrik’s arm. Henrik sees Gerda... alerts Lili. Gerda nods politely and quickly hea in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: INT. WIDOW HOUSE, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Food cooking on the stove. Gerda drinks a glass of wine, thoughtful. Lili arrives home, on eggshells...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: It’s not what you think. Henrik is homosexual. There’s nothing between us. But I should have told you I'd seen him.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No you shouldn’t...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: He’s just a friend, Gerda. Someone to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: (without rancour) Because you can’t talk to me. Gerda pours wine for Lili. She accepts the glass.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: About some things, no. Gerda lifts her glass, proposing a muted toast, but Lili something more on her mind... LILI (cont'd) I’ve made a decision. I’m going back to Dresden. For the second operation. Gerda’s blood runs cold.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It’s too soon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: No, it’s time. I need to finish what I started.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You’re not strong enough...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Professor Warnekros thinks I am...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Warnekros...? He hasn’t seen you.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I’ve made up my mind. Gerda shakes her head, disbelief...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It could kill you.

dialogues.speaker: LILI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going on Friday. Will you come with me? Gerda’s mind races to absorb the announcement...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I won’t help you to hurt yourself. Lili bites down on it:

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Gerda, will you come...? INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, LILI’S ROOM, RAINY NIGHT 82. Lili’s sitting up in bed, Gerda’s bright scarf around her shoulders. Warnekros holds Lili’s wrist, checks the pulse

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: This will be harder than the last operation? You understand that.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Yes I do. A note of warning.

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: It’s complex surgery.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: And I‘1l sleep all the way through it! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: Yes you will, but...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: You’1l be there when I wake up. Lili half-jokes: LILI (cont'd) I want a husband who looks just like you! Then, more thoughtful: LILI (CONT'D) (cont'd) And maybe a child. Like a real woman. Warnekros nods, kindly, but...

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: One step at a time. He gets up. WARNEKROS (cont'd) Get some rest, now. Goodnight. He smiles, goes to the door. Gerda’s waiting outside. The cross in the doorway, polite but not warm. Lili smiles, seeing Gerda. Gerda sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: You're still angry with me.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I’m not angry with you, I’m worried about you. Gerda lays her head in Lili’s lap, tired with anxiety. Li strokes her hair. We feel the depth of love between them.

dialogues.speaker: LILI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You heard my wish Gerda. When no one else could hear me, you did. Gerda’s eyes begin to fill. She collects herself.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Come. We both need our rest. I can sleep in the chair, there...

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Off to your little hotel.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I don’t mind... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Lili insists.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Are there chocolates on the pillow?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Cigarette burns. Lili laughs, kisses Gerda’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Take this... There’s a chill in the air. Lili goes to hand over Gerda’s scarf, but:

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You keep it. For now. Lili smiles, a little mischievous. But then a look betwee them. Gerda’s afraid.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I’m going to be fine. Gerda nods, determined to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Sleep well.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Lili is determinedly bright. Gerda takes her coat and bag The door closes behind her. A couple of moments pass and then Lili begins to dissolve, releasing tears of overwhel fear and anticipation...

dialogues.speaker: INT. DRESDEN HOTEL, RECEPTION, NIGHT
dialogues.text: The CONCIERGE approaches, solicitous.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Room 9. The concierge turns to get Gerda’s key. The sound of a cocktail piano in an adjacent room serves to reinforce he isolation. But then she sees reflected in the mirror - a familiar face - GERDA (CONT'D) (cont'd) Hans...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gerda turns, barely holding herself together... he catche her in a heavy, passionate embrace. A huge sense of relie reunion, trust.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: It’s alright. Gerda nods, greatly comforted by his presence.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Everything will be alright. Gerda hangs on to Hans, desperately wanting it to be true INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, LILI’S ROOM, DAWN A nurse helps a quietly determined Lili into a surgical g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warnerkros, scrubbed in, serious, ready to begin.

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: Good luck, everybody. Lili anaesthetised. We stay on her face, hear voices, the clank of instruments. Rain beginning... the sound of it increasingly intense as the wind comes up too... INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, RECEPTION, NEXT MORNING Morning light streams in, harsh, unforgiving. Hans holds door for Gerda. She’s barely inside when the Receptionist jumps urgently to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Professor Warnekros would like a word... Gerda’s faces register anxiety. Hans gestures - he’s back off. He’ll wait. Gerda hurries away. INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, MORNING Warnekros and Gerda walk purposefully along the corridor

dialogues.speaker: WARNEKROS
dialogues.text: She lost a lot of blood. Now we’re struggling to keep the fever down. There’s a chance it will burn itself out, but... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They arrive at the doorway to Lili’s room. Warnekros show Gerda in. Lili sleeps fitfully, slick with sweat. * Warnekros’s clearly worried. Gerda’s astonished at how il she looks. WARNEKROS (CONT'D) (cont'd) (deeply regretful) I’m sorry... I have to be honest. The prognosis is not... He can’t finish, but Gerda barely hears him anyway...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Go away... thank you. Leave us * alone. Gerda hangs in the doorway, blocking it, until Warnekros obliged to turn away. We follow him, walking back down th corridor, alone, excluded, burdened by failure. * INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, GARDEN, NIGHT Heavy spots of rain begin to splash down. Most of the hospital in darkness. A light glowing in one room. INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, LILI’S ROOM, NIGHT Gerda in the chair at Lili’s bedside, mopping her brow. T rainstorm beating outside. A nurse enters with a jug of water. Gerda nods, grateful. INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, CORRIDOR, DAWN A cleaner works her mop and bucket down the corridor. Han sleeps in a chair up ahead. INT. WARNEKROS’S CLINIC, DRESDEN, LILI’S ROOM Lili sleeping, calmer now. Her face translucent in the morning light. Gerda sleeps in the chair beside her. Gerd wakes, disoriented for a moment, then looks at Lili, slee peacefully, clearly cooler now... Gerda feels her brow - heat there any more... Gerda’s relief is palpable. She smooths Lili’s fringe, then gets up, opens the curtains - wide - the sun just starting to show in the rain-washed s She turns back to see Lili’s eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Lili...? Lili struggles to speak. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GERDA (cont'd) I’m here... just lie still... It’s alright... Lili smiles through her medicated haze. She sees Hans hur in... thrilled to see her awake...

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Oh, Lili. How are you? Her voice is faint, cracked. She takes in Hans and Gerda:

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: I am... entirely myself. Hans laughs gently.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell Warnekros she’s awake. Hans goes. Gerda sits back beside Lili, fixes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: You know you had us worried... Lili’s frail, otherworldly, but her eyes burn bright. She looks to the window.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Can I go outside, Gerda? Into the garden?

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: I think you should rest... But Lili takes Gerda’s hand, a great sense of calm in her She looks at Gerda. Gerda still there, always there.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerda wheels Lili out in a wheelchair, Hans holding the d open for her to pass. A glance between him and Gerda, the he leaves the women alone. Gerda is settles herself in a chair beside Lili, rests he hand on Lili’s arm. The birch trees in Spring leaf. A lig breeze makes them quiver. Lili’s breathing is shallow. We feel the depth of love between the women, and the precariousness of their situation.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: You mustn’t worry about me any more, Gerda. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: It’s an old habit. I’m slow to change.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: How have I ever deserved such love? Gerda struggles to remain composed. LILI (cont'd) I’m sorry you were frightened. There’s nothing to be afraid of any more.

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: You know, last night, I had the most beautiful dream... I dreamed I was a baby in my mother’s arms... and she looked down at me... and called me Lili... Gerda is amazed, deeply moved...

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: Lili... Lili’s features arrange themselves into an expression of perfect joy as she sinks back into something which Gerda gradually sees is deeper than sleep... GERDA (cont'd) Lili... Gerda clutches the hand... No response... Smooths the brow... still nothing... GERDA (CONT'D) (cont'd) Lili...? Gerda presses Lili’s hand against her cheek, overwhelmed grief. Lili looks blissfully happy. The dawn light grows stronger in the garden...

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. JUTLAND, DAWN, TWO WEEKS LATER
dialogues.text: Hans’ car rolls into the bleak landscape. Hans and Gerda inside. Gerda looks out - at a landscape she knows with absolute intimacy, although she’s never been here before. It’s all here... the imagery from Einar’s paintings, sing with life... A wild stretch of rocky green under soft northern light, a row of beautiful black-limbed trees, be over, but not broken, by the wind... 26/11/15  89.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CLIFFS OVERLOOKING KATTEGAT SEA, JUTLAND, MORNING
dialogues.text: Hans tails Gerda. She battles the incredible gusts of sal air, the bright scarf flying like a flag at her throat. S pushes on, closer to the cliff edge... Finally she reache an amazing vantage point, is stunned by the view: a recta of ferociously stormy sea, silver waves whipped by a wind that stings, relentless. We hear the RUSTLE and PUNCH of weather going at her. Hans joins her. They stand there looking out until they can hardly breathe any more. Hans takes her armto steady her, but as she turns toward the wind rips up under the bright scarf, snatches it into air. Gerda GASPS - a moment of loss - but then, something else... As Hans hurries to try and catch it -

dialogues.speaker: GERDA
dialogues.text: No - leave it..! Leave it.. She pulls him back, watches it dance, tears of joy in her eyes... GERDA (CONT’D) Let it fly... The scarf swoops up and dives down, curls and rolls, as f as child... a girl at play. Gerda clutches her coat at he breast, almost delirious at the beauty of it. Hans watche with her - the absurdly joyous spectacle of it, a stunnin farewell. And as the scarf dances out from the cliff, out sea... into eternity...
